intro: Pericampylus formosanus, commonly known as the Taiwan pericampylus, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a subtle aromatic scent. Pericampylus formosanus is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
